title: NBA Daily Digest: February 13, 2026
subtitle: LeBron Makes History as All-Star Weekend Tips Off!

items.headline: LeBron James Becomes Oldest Player with Triple-Double in NBA History!
items.summary: At 41 years and 44 days old, Lakers superstar LeBron James made history last night, recording 28 points, 12 assists, and 10 rebounds in a dominant 124-104 victory over the Dallas Mavericks. This monumental performance surpasses Karl Malone's previous record, marking James' 123rd career triple-double.

items.headline: All-Star Weekend 2026 Kicks Off Today in Los Angeles!
items.summary: The NBA's biggest midseason celebration officially begins today at the Intuit Dome in Inglewood. Tonight's events include the NBA All-Star Celebrity Game and the Rising Stars Challenge, showcasing the league's emerging talent.

items.headline: Avdija Sits Out, Doncic & Flagg Nurse Injuries Ahead of All-Star Break
items.summary: Portland Trail Blazers All-Star Deni Avdija missed last night's game due to 'injury management' (back). Meanwhile, Dallas Mavericks' Luka Doncic missed his fourth straight game with a mild hamstring strain and is expected back after the All-Star break. Rookie Cooper Flagg is also sidelined with a sprained foot, impacting his All-Star weekend participation.

items.headline: Clippers Eyeing Kawhi Leonard Trade After Harden Deal?
items.summary: Following the blockbuster trade sending James Harden to the Cleveland Cavaliers for Darius Garland and a 2026 second-round pick, speculation is mounting that the Los Angeles Clippers could look to move Kawhi Leonard. The franchise appears to be shifting towards a rebuild, focusing on youth and financial flexibility.

items.headline: Lakers Dominate Mavs Behind LeBron's Historic Night
items.summary: LeBron James' historic triple-double led the Lakers to a comfortable win over a short-handed Mavericks squad.

items.headline: Trail Blazers Top Jazz in High-Scoring Affair
items.summary: Jrue Holiday exploded for a season-best 31 points as the Blazers defeated the Jazz.

items.headline: Cavaliers Cruise Past Wizards
items.summary: Donovan Mitchell led the Cavaliers to a decisive victory over the Wizards.

items.headline: Bucks Outlast Magic in Close Contest
items.summary: Cam Thomas' 34 points and Kevin Porter's triple-double powered the Bucks to a win against the Magic.

items.headline: Hornets Sting Hawks in Tight Matchup
items.summary: Brandon Miller delivered a strong performance to help the Hornets edge out the Hawks.

items.headline: Celtics Handle Bulls with Ease
items.summary: Peyton Pritchard's scoring outburst propelled the Celtics over the Bulls.

items.headline: Pistons Extend Streak Over Raptors
items.summary: Cade Cunningham led the Pistons to their third consecutive win, defeating the Raptors.

items.headline: Heat Burn Pelicans
items.summary: Bam Adebayo's double-double was key in the Heat's victory over the Pelicans.

items.headline: Knicks Route 76ers
items.summary: The Knicks offense was clicking, overpowering the 76ers in a high-scoring affair.

items.headline: Clippers Hold Off Rockets
items.summary: Kawhi Leonard's double-double helped the Clippers secure a narrow win against the Rockets.

items.headline: Nuggets Top Grizzlies Behind Jokic's Triple-Double
items.summary: Nikola Jokic posted another triple-double to lead the Nuggets past the Grizzlies.

items.headline: Thunder Strike Down Suns
items.summary: Jaylen Williams was instrumental in the Thunder's dominant win over the Suns.

items.headline: Spurs Defeat Warriors as Wembanyama Shines
items.summary: De'Aaron Fox and Victor Wembanyama led the Spurs to a victory over the Warriors.

items.headline: Pacers Edge Out Nets
items.summary: The Pacers secured a victory in a tight game against the Nets.

items.headline: Deni Avdija (POR) - All-Star Selection
items.statContext: Missed last game due to injury management

items.headline: NBA Trade Deadline Recap: Key Moves Before Feb. 5th
items.summary: The recent NBA trade deadline on February 5th saw significant activity. Notable deals included James Harden to CLE, Trae Young to WAS, and Jaren Jackson Jr. to UTA. The Clippers, in particular, appear to be retooling after moving Harden, leading to speculation around Kawhi Leonard's future.

items.headline: Star Player Injury Rundown
items.summary: Luka Doncic (DAL) is dealing with a mild hamstring strain and is out until after the All-Star break. Rookie Cooper Flagg (DAL) has a sprained foot and will miss All-Star weekend events. Deni Avdija (POR) sat out his last game due to back injury management. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (OKC) has been sidelined with injuries, impacting the Thunder's recent games.

items.headline: Eastern & Western Conference Standings Update
items.summary: As of February 12th, the Detroit Pistons lead the Eastern Conference with a 40-13 record, while the Oklahoma City Thunder hold the top spot in the Western Conference at 42-13. The playoff picture continues to shape up with teams jockeying for position ahead of the postseason.
